section.title: Linkset Management
section.para: Linksets are managed with the linkset command range. The linkset command lets you perform the following actions:

listitem.para: create linkset
delete linkset
activate linkset
deactivate linkset
create link
delete link
activate link
deactivate link
list state of linksets and present links

section.title: Create Linkset
section.para: A linkset can be created by issuing the linkset create command with the following structure:
Or, if using dialogic:
section.programlisting: linkset create dialogic opc <point-code> apc <point-code> ni <network-id> srcmod <src-mode> destmod <dest-mode> <linkset-name>
section.para: Where:

listitem.para: Refers to the type of linkset to be created, for example, dahdi, dialogic, or m3ua. These values depend on the linkset factories that have been deployed.
Defines the MTP point - either local (opc) or remote (dpc).
Defines the network identifier. It can have following values:
International network
Spare (for international use only)
National network
Reserved for national use
Defines the simple string used to identify this linkset.

example.title: Linkset creation
example.screen: mobicents(10.65.208.215:3435)>linkset create dahdi opc 1 apc 2 ni 0 linkset1 LinkSet successfully added mobicents(10.65.208.215:3435)>linkset create dialogic opc 3 apc 4 ni 3 srcmod 1 destmod 2 linkset2 LinkSet successfully added

section.title: Create Link
section.para: A Link can be created in Linkset by issuing a command with the following structure:
section.programlisting: linkset link create span <span-num> code <code-num> channel <channel-num> <linkset-name> <link-name>
section.para: Where:

listitem.para: An integer representing the port number in card (indexed from 0).
The link code (sls assigned to this link).
An integer indicating the time slot number (TDM time slot).
The name set during linkset creation.
The name that identifies this link within the linkset.

example.title: Link Create Example
example.screen: mobicents(10.65.208.215:3435)>linkset link create span 1 code 1 channel 1 linkset1 link1 Link successfully added

section.title: Show status
section.para: The status of Linksets and Links can be viewed by issuing a command with the following structure:

example.title: Linkset Status
example.screen: mobicents(10.65.208.215:3435)>linkset show linkset1 dahdi opc=1 apc=2 ni=0 state=UNAVAILABLE link1 span=1 channelId=1 code=1 state=UNAVAILABLE

section.para: The possible state of Linkset are

listitem.para: UNAVAILABLE : Indicates the linkset does not have any “available” links and cannot transport traffic
SHUTDOWN : Indicates the linkset has been shutdown in the configuration
AVAILABLE : Indicates the linkset has at least one available link and can carry traffic

section.para: The possible state of Link are

listitem.para: UNAVAILABLE : Indicates the link is not available to carry traffic. This can occur if the link is remotely or locally inhibited by a user. It can also be unavailable if MTP2 has not been able to successfully activate the link connection.
SHUTDOWN : Indicates the link has been shutdown in the configuration.
AVAILABLE : Indicates the link is active and able to transport traffic

FAILED : A link is FAILED when the link is not shutdown but is unavailable at layer2 for some reason. For example Initial Alignment failed or the link test messages sent by MTP3 are not being acknowledged.
